instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
a 820-3437 board has orange light on the charger, all the S5, S3 and S4 rails are present except PP3V3_S4SW_SNS
U8050 gets PP3V3_S5 but PP3V3_S4SW_SNS_FET_R and SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN are missing
there is alsono short on the line

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN appears on S0 state; your board is stuck in S3, as you told...
PM_SLP_S3_L goes high, or pulse at least?

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message: PM_SLP_S3_L is 3.32v

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
That means your board is in S0 state.
So all the voltages controlled by PM_SLP_S3_L should appear.
Check "S0 Enables" signals at page 59.
Be sure you get correct PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L first...

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
thanks for your replay,
PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L = 3.30
P5VS0_EN = 3,30
P3V3S0_EN = 3.30
P1V05S0_EN = 3,30

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message: Then all these power supplies mentioned should be present too; check that.

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
Pp1v05_sus 1,05
pp1v8_s3 1,80
pp1v5_s0 1.50
pp1v5_s0sz_audio_adh 1,5
pp3v3_sus 3.32
                                            pp3v3_s4 39.6 mili volt
pp3v3_s3 3,28
pp3v3_s0_fet_r  3,28
pch_hsio_pwr_en 2,55
s5_pwr_en 3.4
s4_pwr_en 3.328
usb_pwr_en 3.28
pm_slp_s4_l 3.28
p3v3s3_en 3,28
p1v8s3_en 3,27
ddrreg_en 3,28

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
"pp3v3_s4 39.6 mili volt"
Is there short, or low value?
Post U8000 voltages; you may need to change it...

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
I've replaced the U8000 and
pin1 PP3V3_S4_FET_R 3.02v
pin2 PP3V3_S5 3.32V
pin3 PP3V3_S4_FET_R 3.02v
pin4 PP3V3_S5 3.32V
pin 6 S4_PWR_EN 3.32

I've replaced the U8050 but nothing's changed I get
pin1/3 PP3V3_S4SW_SNS_FET_R 0.3v
pin 2/4 PP3V3_S5 3.32v
pin 6 SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN 0

I tried to bypass the SMC Sensor but the charger light changes from amber to green and again amber but the fan doesn't spin.
the fan is known working one and also there is no USB activity.

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message: Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
yes I did. tried to bypass the SMC but the charger light changes from amber to green and again amber but the fan doesn't spin.
the fan is known working one and also there is no USB activity.

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
I talk about SMC bypass, not SMC reset.
Use Google, is already explained in the forum how to do it...

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
all of the sudden the light on the charger is gone and System_Onewire is dropped down to 0.8v but SMC_BC_ACOK is present 3.4
SMC_RESET_L is. 3.37

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
Disconnect LIO flex and see if SYS_ONEWIRE goes high.
Don't forget to try SMC bypass!

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
I tried to bypass smc by holding the power key for 10 second and connect the charger ( while keep pressing the power for the next 10 second ).
the board didn't power on but the light on the charger is back

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
Check voltage for all big coils.
ALL_SYS_PWRGD goes high, or pulse at least?

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message: ALL_SYS_PWRGD is 0,111v

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message: Do you get any S3, or S0 voltages?

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
Pp3v3_s3
pp1v8_s3
pp1v2_s3
pp3v3_s0

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
Do you mean these voltages are present and steady?
Check all the voltages involved in ALL_SYS_PWRGD generation...

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
yes sir these voltages are present.
Could you please explain a little more about the involved voltages in ALL_SYS_PWRGD geberation+

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
Look at page 59 of schematic.
There appear all the VMON and PGOOD signals which finally generate ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
If one of these signals misses, check the corresponding power supply...

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
Thank you Sir for explanation,
p
S5_PWR_EN is present
S4_PWR_EN is present
P3V3S3_EN is present
S5_PWRGD is present
Q8150
pin1 VMON_Q1_BASE0,78v
pin3 0.11v
pin4 0,11v
pin5 VMON_Q2_BASE 0.00
pin6 S0_PGD_C 3,27v
pin7 VMON_Q3_BASE 0,70
pin 2 and 8 are unconnected according to the schematic but I measure 0.12v on them

threads.title: 820-3437 the PP3V3_S4SW_SNS is missing
threads.message:
"pin5 VMON_Q2_BASE 0.00"
Missing PP5V_S0?
If present, check R8151/2/3 and C8159...
